applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to the pension life cover scheme rules document for several reasons: 1) The regulation specifically addresses situations where a consumer policyholder is not the beneficiary of a settlement. In this document, the scheme is an occupational pension scheme where the employer is the policyholder (not a consumer) and the trustee manages the policy on behalf of the member's dependants. 2) The document outlines a group life insurance scheme established by an employer for employees, which falls under occupational pension regulations rather than consumer protection regulations. 3) The beneficiaries (dependants) are determined by the trustee according to scheme rules, and the employer/trustee relationship is governed by pension legislation rather than consumer protection regulations. 4) The document specifically states it is regulated by the Pensions Act and Revenue requirements, not consumer protection regulations. The settlement process described in the document follows pension scheme rules rather than consumer protection requirements.
regulation_title: Information concerning settlement where a consumer policyholder is not the beneficiary
regulation_text: 368. (1) Where a policyholder who is a consumer is not the beneficiary of a settlement, the insurance undertaking shall advise the policyholder at the time that settlement is made, on paper or on another durable medium, of the following: (a) subject to paragraph (2), the amount for which the claim has been settled and the reason or reasons for it being settled; (b) where applicable, that the settlement of the claim will affect future insurance contracts entered into by the policyholder of the type that was the subject of the settlement. (2) Paragraph (1)(a) does not apply to a claim in respect of which section 16(4)(d) of the Act of 2019 applies. Part 5 Investments Chapter 1 Preliminary
